post.text: So...what exactly did we learn tonight about Donald Trump's economic plan? #RNCinCLE

comment.author: Hailey
comment.text: You Hillary and the Obama administration have participated in raising our federal deficit up to almost 20 trillion dollars. What are you going to do now?

replies.author: Grant
replies.text: Actually the origin of that deficit is the war in Iraq. Hmmm, Hillary voted for it but so did Pence. The Donald was for it until he was against it.

replies.author: Grant
replies.text: And yes it was started by a Bush with Daddy issues based on lies told by the Veep. The deficit has actually shrunk over the last 8 years

replies.author: Hailey
replies.text: When President Obama signs into law the new two-year budget deal Monday, his action will bring into sharper focus a part of his legacy that he doesn't like to talk about: He is the $20 trillion man. Mr. Obama's spending agreement with Congress will suspend the nation's debt limit and allow the Treasury to borrow another $1.5 trillion or so by the end of his presidency in 2017. Added to the current total national debt of more than $18.15 trillion, the red ink will likely be crowding the $20 trillion mark right around the time Mr. Obama leaves the White House. Hillary will follow in Obamas footsteps! Vote for Trump! ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸
